Over the weekend, we saw COVID-19 spread through the administration and the Senate—including to two members of the Judiciary Committee.

Proceeding with the Supreme Court nomination when we don't yet know the extent of the spread would be reckless and put more people at risk.

Government can be a powerful force for good in times of crisis—but only if it works for the people. 

We have a chance to come back from this stronger than ever if we make investments that lift up our communities and elect leaders who put people first. 

We are not without hope.

We’ve got to vote like our democracy depends on it—because it does. 

If you live in one of these states, register to vote or double-check your registration status today: https://twitter.com/WhenWeAllVote/status/1313175798250172416 QT @WhenWeAllVote 🚨 VOTER REGISTRATION DEADLINES TODAY 🚨

I am honored to support my good friend and Navy veteran @GaryPeters for re-election to the U.S. Senate, and to fight alongside him to build an America that works for everyone. Michigan can count on Gary to keep fighting for our small businesses, hospitals, and frontline workers. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EjkumaMWsAAfbJI.jpg

I look forward to working with @JakeAuch as representatives of our great state. In the Marines, in business, and as a public servant in local government, Jake has worked to protect our nation and uplift working families. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EjkumFnWoAEV2z4.jpg

As a mayor, veteran, and Bronze Star recipient, Adrian Perkins knows firsthand how to lead in times of crisis. The people of Louisiana deserve a senator who will fight for working families. I'm happy to support Gil in CA-39. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EjkulaUWsAAk2eX.jpg

As a decorated combat veteran and working mom, @MJHegar is a proven fighter. She will ensure every Texan has affordable health care, economic opportunity, and a government that works for them. I’m proud to support MJ in her fight to deliver real results for the people of Texas. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EjkulFjXsAIQIdu.jpg

South and West Texans need a representative who will stand up to corporate special interests. I know @GinaOrtizJones will be a tireless champion for working families. I’m proud to support Gina in her effort to flip TX-23 and make real change in Washington. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ejkukq8WoAAn3Sz.jpg

I’m proud to support @PamKeithFL, an inspirational public servant and leader whose advocacy is grounded in deep empathy and innovative solutions. Pam is a Navy veteran who has dedicated her life to giving back to her community—and who will show up and fight for FL-18 in Congress. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EjkukT8WoAADInt.jpg

Whether serving our country in uniform or in Congress, @JasonCrowCO6 has never shied away from a fight. I’ve watched him hold a lawless president accountable, stand up to the gun lobby, and protect affordable health care. I’m proud to endorse Jason Crow for re-election. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ejkuj-VWsAAerB_.jpg

My three brothers all served in the military. I'm so grateful for their—and for all veterans'—service. Today, I’m excited to highlight the incredible veterans I’ve endorsed, who are running for office to put people first. https://ewar.ren/endorsed http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EjkujYrWkAEu-77.jpg

In addition, voting sites are opening today near three colleges: East Lansing near MSU, on campus at Western Michigan University and Northern Michigan University. Detroit is also opening 21 early voting sites across the city which will be open 7 days a week until Election Day.

In Michigan, early voting already begun in every township, but you can still register to vote online until October 19 and in person until Election Day. In other words, you can vote or register to vote right now no matter where you live in the state. https://twitter.com/BernieSanders/status/1313220319402848256 QT @BernieSanders The working class of America is in more desperation today than at any time since the Great Depression of the 1930s.
